website_summaries.verdict: Balances well on oven racks thanks to a broad base. The large dial is easy to read through the door.
pros: At more than 3" wide, the large, clear dial is easy to read
It boasts the largest temperature range (from 100ºF to 600ºF) of all thermometers we tested, for peace of mind while roasting and broiling
cons: Some owners have noted the dial yellows and becomes harder to read with age

customer_reviews.title: This item is very low quality
customer_reviews.text: Hello, So here is my experience with it. It's just a thermometer so I wasn't looking for anything high end. Well this item stopped working within 5 minutes of use. After taking it out of the oven the needle didn't move and stayed at 200. Then after I moved it around, it just went down in one shot. So I tried it again. The oven was a 355 degrees, the thermometer was saying that it was at 200. The needle hasn't moved since then. This simply doesn't work. So I am giving you the heads up.
customer_reviews.author: AB2

customer_reviews.title: This is a baker must have!
customer_reviews.text: Oven temperatures vary and if it’s too far off from the temperature you think you set it at your baking creation might not turn out the way you hope. I think oven thermometers are a must have for serious bakers. This one works great. We recently moved and I could not find my original Taylor Classic oven thermometer after the move. I strongly suspected the temperature of the oven at the new house was quite a bit off. I ordered a new thermometer, and I am so happy I did. The oven I was using was running 50+ degrees higher than expected. With the thermometer I could adjust the temperature appropriately and my family didn’t have to eat overcooked/burnt food.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mumm

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money. Not accurate.
customer_reviews.text: We recently moved into a new apartment and noticed the oven was off so we got this thermometer to make sure we weren't going to burn anything. We were still having problems so our landlord sent a repair man out to look at the oven. He did say the thermostat was bad in the oven and replaced it but he also checked this thermometer with his very accurate professional thermometer and it was off by a long shot. Isnt even remotely close. Spend a couple bucks more on a different thermometer. It will save you in the long run. After a week of owning this one its already going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Ethen

customer_reviews.title: It’s...
customer_reviews.text: garbage. I have tested it several times, and it doesn’t register a temperature above 350 F. Even when I have the oven turned on at higher temperatures (375 and above), the needle stops between 325-350, not once has it gone above it. My stove is less than 1 y old, and I bought the thermometer to help me calibrated it for baking and roasting during the holidays. The item is not returnable so I pretty much purchased a piece of trash.
customer_reviews.author: Blizt

customer_reviews.title: the front got super grimey, but once it cooled down I cleaned ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well in our grill. I got it really gross when we had a large grease fire in the grill...metal got all discolored, the front got super grimey, but once it cooled down I cleaned it with dish soap and it came right back (though the metal is still discolored, but who cares). Despite the probably searing heat it endured, still reads temperatures well. Useful for grilling - the thermometer mounted in the lid is never accurate for the actual cooking surface, especially in a two-zone cooking method.
customer_reviews.author: John Seale

customer_reviews.title: Defective after less than a month and unable to return
customer_reviews.text: I owned the thermometer less than a month and when I opened the oven just now to turn it on I discovered that the front of the "glass" (thick plastic?) had cracked. I tried to return the item only to be told I could not. I am not happy with this item as well as the lack of customer support for something that broke after less than a month and honestly the oven being turned on less than 10 times.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Necessity for any baker
customer_reviews.text: If you're baking anything other than boxed cake mix, you need this thermometer for your oven. I only realized how poorly calibrated my oven was when I started to venture into bread making. While I' not a professional baker by any definition, I do appreciate the control this thermometer provides. My oven was incorrect by 50 degrees F at some oven set temperatures! This little, inexpensive device can really help your baking game and I'd definitely recommend it for any baker.
customer_reviews.author: AMG de Wet

customer_reviews.title: Good price bu not sure of it's accuracy
customer_reviews.text: It's okay for the price but I'm not sure of it's accuracy. I purchased because it seemed like my oven was underbaking when I followed the time listed on recipes for cookies etc. and I wanted to see if the temperature setting was accurate. I ended up with two of these (I bought one on Amazon while my husband bought one at a physical store not realizing I'd ordered). We put them both in our oven just to see and they regularly show very different temperatures, even when placed very close to one another. They do seem to survive very well though in the oven, even at hot temperatures so the durability for the price is very good.
customer_reviews.author: austenfitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: It's turning brown and the accuracy is not great.  Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: After less than 30 days of use, it is turning dark brown and getting more difficult to read. As far a temperature accuracy goes it's within +-10 degree's which is not terrible but not great. I could have lived with that just fine but it is gradually getting darker (see picture) and I expect it will be impossible to read in a few months. I reached out and Amazon refunded my purchase. I'll be doing some more review reading and trying a different product. NOT RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.author: Tiger88

customer_reviews.title: Repeatedly unreliable
customer_reviews.text: When we received it in the mail, it didn't work. It would read 150 or 200 while in a 350 deg....and then read 150 or 200 while on the counter. So - Amazon sent a replacement. Good service! Then the 2nd one delivered temperature, but the glass cracked after a dozen or so uses. Now I'm past the return window and outta luck. I recommend buying a different brand - the appealing prices and good reviews were a false lead for me on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Walker

customer_reviews.title: In my opinion, it doesn't give an accurate temperature reading.
customer_reviews.text: I checked my oven temperature with 2 other oven thermometers that I have owned for a few years and were actual Taylor products. The older 2 oven thermometers that I owned shared the same temperature as the oven setting. The third one which is this newest one was off 50 degrees when compared with the other two I owned and also the oven setting I used. The reason I purchased this new Taylor oven temperature oven thermometer was that I was going to gift it to my niece. Needless to say, I discarded this new one and I am still using the two older ones that I own.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: So much better than my old smaller Taylor oven thermometer!
customer_reviews.text: I am not a fan of Taylor oven thermometers-until NOW! The only reason I purchased this one was because I needed one immediately and another brand was going to take way too long to get here. I am astounded that it works. I am very pleased that due to the larger size you can actually see the temperature through the oven door and not have to open the door and get your face "fried" from the intense heat. This is definitely a 5 star product. Don't hesitate to purchase it-you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JanC-FL

customer_reviews.title: Three thermometers broken in two months
customer_reviews.text: After about a month, it became darkened and impossible to read. I contacted the company for a replacement. They apologized saying the product must have been defective and sent out a replacement....that one lasted two weeks, got a third replacement.....lasted two weeks. Contacted Amazon and got a full refund. This is a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Eliyahu E.

customer_reviews.title: Glass Lens? That's a Flat-Out Lie
customer_reviews.text: The description reads in part, "Oven safe durability: glass lens...", but when the unit shook loose from my oven rack and fell onto an electric heating element, the very plastic lens melted. I did not mind loosing the thermometer itself but getting the dried plastic off the heating element was such a challenge that I did not use the oven for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Walsh

customer_reviews.title: It does not work!!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to know if the oven was keeping a steady temperature. This gauge only went to 300, wouldn't go any higher even though the oven registered 350. I borrowed another gauge from a friend to check the temperature, hers registered correctly so I knew the gauge was wrong. I called Amazon and was given a refund on a gift card (the best way to get the refund, only takes a couple of hours to apply!) then threw the defective item away!! Don't waste your money on this, however, if you want to take a chance and it doesn't work, call Amazon they will make it right for you.
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: Very handy for oven and bbq
customer_reviews.text: Very handy for inside an oven and bbq. I always suspected my oven temp was not accurate. Bake time and temp for cakes and brownies always seemed off. Well, now I know! My actual oven temp is 15 degrees lower than what it supposed to be. So, for best baking results, I go by this thermometer, not what my stove says. Also great for the bbq. This thermometer helps me keep the temp more regulated (like an oven) and I use it a lot more. Really glad I got this item.
customer_reviews.author: ReindeerGames

customer_reviews.title: Best $10 investment
customer_reviews.text: Best $10 investment I ever made. Was having issues with my oven heating up so I wanted to test the temperature and bought the thermometer. I had NO idea how “off” my oven was. I bake a lot and I thought I knew my oven pretty well before this but now that I can see the real temp my baking times have changed. The “preheat” setting on my oven was always 10min to get to 350 but I found that with the thermometer it actually takes about 15-20 to reach 350. I highly recommend, even if your oven is fine but you bake a lot...it makes a huge difference to be able to visualize he real temp.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: OK, but falls over too easily
customer_reviews.text: It's difficult to rate the accuracy of this thermometer as I bought it to check the accuracy of our oven. I hope it's accurate, but that's all I can say for certain. The face of the thermometer is easy to read, but the stand is thin and unstable and falls over too easily. As a result, I have to open the oven door and grab the thermometer with an oven mitt on (which takes a few moments), so I don't know if I'm causing the oven to cool a bit because the door is open.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Nice device to test and calibrate ove temps
customer_reviews.text: Used this to calibrate double oven temps. This device had Reproducible intradevice temps over several days with 1 degree variation. Interdevice (this one and Lower oven temp) were off 10 degrees and I am sure the most accurate measurement was this one since the lower oven was always cooking hot. Using this device i found upper oven heating 10 degrees cooler than on the oven digital readout. Have changed the electronic oven thermostat to heat accurately and both ovens now agree with oven digitalvdisplay, oven temp as measured by this device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken in less than 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thermometer as a backup to make sure I was getting accurate temperature readings on my ovens digital display. It recently noticed that it seemed to be far off from the temperature my oven was reading, and thought maybe my oven thermometer needed to be replaced. It turns out that this Taylor thermometer I bought less than 6 months ago is actually the problem and is showing a temperature about 75 degrees below the true temperature. I would not buy this product again because I expected it to last much longer than six months. This is not being used in a commercial kitchen where it would be subject to possible wear and tear due to excessive use.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Green

customer_reviews.title: Accurate temperature
customer_reviews.text: I tested this thermometer in an 18-year-old black and decker toaster oven (yes 18 years - don't make them like this anymore), electric oven, and gas oven. The temperature was accurate. I was going to replace my toaster oven due to age and the broken handle. Two thermometer showed it was still cooking at the correct temperature. Also purchased Rubbermaid Commercial Products Stainless Steel Instant Read Oven/Grill/Smoker Monitoring Thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: linda

customer_reviews.title: This item does not work
customer_reviews.text: I hate to write negative reviews. But this one is necessary. My first thermometer was stuck at 350F. Wouldn't go up or down. Oven was at 500F. It can't be that far off. A replacement came quickly. It was stuck at 226F when the oven was at 500F. I use the oven a lot, things seem fine at around 350 - 400F. I was unsure when I was using it for breads, at 450 - 500F. Hence this purchase. But it's no help.
customer_reviews.author: K. Soo

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival, AND They do not take returns!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY...This thermometer arrived broken. It will not read any temperature. the same day it arrived and I tested it, I tried to return it, but when I clicked on the return button, I was informed that it was NON RETURNABLE! I wish I had been informed of this in their ad, I might have thought twice. Don't be fooled like I was!
customer_reviews.author: C. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy & Unstable
customer_reviews.text: This oven thermometer cannot be clipped securely to a rail of an oven rack. It can be dangled from a rail, or set atop the surface of a rack, but there is no way to install it securely. Any unstable object in a hot oven is inherently unsafe. I'll be putting this product in recycling and replacing it with a commercial-quality oven thermometer that can be firmly attached to an oven rack.
customer_reviews.author: T. Tinker

customer_reviews.title: Works well but won't stand upright
customer_reviews.text: Got to confirm the actual temp in my new over for baking polymer clay. There's nothing to hang it on since I use top rack placed in the middle and it falls over easily so doesn't stand upright unless I put it on it's own tile/pan and even then, just sliding the rack in makes it tip over easily. It's a tad hard to read through oven window. I discovered my oven is about 8 degrees lower than it says!
customer_reviews.author: J. BushTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different thermometer
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed with this thermometer at all. It takes forever to get a reading (I'll have it in the oven for over an hour while I'm baking and it will not have read the temperature yet) and when it does, it's inaccurate. Don't buy this thermometer! I wish I could return it but I've had it for too long now.
customer_reviews.author: RBTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: don't trust this thermostat
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thing because the thermostat in my oven went out. It worked for less then 2 months, then got stuck on 325 degrees. I'm cooking ribs thinking it's 325 degrees when it was much higher, much. Piece of junk. don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: Aliceiam

customer_reviews.title: Not an accurate reading
customer_reviews.text: I found my old oven thermometer after this one arrived. I wanted to validate my oven temperature. This one’s reading 360° in a 400° oven. The old thermometer is reading 400° in the 400° oven. Not worth the cost and time of returning.
customer_reviews.author: WAYNE

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: My oven didn’t seem to be running properly even though two services calls claimed it did - my baked goods were still coming out incorrectly. This little guy hangs on the shelf and it wonderful at telling me the ACTUAL temp of my oven. No more poorly baked goods! And I can check the temp on it by turning on the oven light - meaning I don’t have to open the door and let out the precious heat just to check the temp
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Might need calibration?
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if it's my oven that's off or if it's the thermometer that's off. When my oven is set at like 350° the thermometer will read at 300° and I don't know which one is wrong. I mean, it's okay for now. I'll have to try another one to make sure I'm not going crazy. But other than that, it's easy to read. It's a lot bigger than I thought so that's good.
customer_reviews.author: Sus.An

customer_reviews.title: and my oven sucks. I realized that I could actually
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few months now, and the other day I was making a dish the required a certain temperature... and my oven sucks. I realized that I could actually...finally read the temperature in the oven because of this product. I was able to adjust accordingly. Why let a cheap, unreadable product like your old thermometer...ruin an expensive dish and the evening? Get this. Forget that.
customer_reviews.author: Waterboy

customer_reviews.title: Dial rotated and yields untrustworthy temp readings
customer_reviews.text: After a few uses, the face of the thermometer rotated and I am uncertain of an accurate temp reading. It disagrees with 2 different oven temp readings, and cannot be trusted. I'm deleting this product from my life and buying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: RPN

customer_reviews.title: Slow to register proper temp
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought it didn’t work. I tried returning it only to find there are NO RETURNS! I figured since I had to keep it I’d leave it in my oven. I thought my oven was running hot and had adjusted the temp accordingly. After being in the oven nearly 30 minutes,this thermometer registered what I thought the temp should be. Just takes awhile. It’s definitely not instant read and not even after its left in the oven during the preheat time. It takes awhile!
customer_reviews.author: P. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Unable to contact Amazon customer service for a replacement.
customer_reviews.text: This came to me with a bent foot. It is designed to sit on an oven rack, but with a bent foot it will not do so. I have tried repeatedly to arrange a return/ replacement, but I'd myself on an endless loop on the computer. I cannot seem to contact either Amazon customer service online, chat or by phone. I have never had this problem before.
customer_reviews.author: C. Alesiani

customer_reviews.title: Colors Faded to Grey/Black in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for a smidge over 3 months. Here’s what it looks like now. It has only been in my oven. Seemed accurate in the beginning. (It calibrated with my stove’s temp, do that was good.) but I really can hardly see the dial now, so it’s useless.
customer_reviews.author: CatherineL A2

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money -- needle stuck below 150
customer_reviews.text: For a short time (couple of weeks) after purchase, this thermometer worked fine. Then the needle started sticking and wouldn't move above the resting position without a "nudge" to the thermometer. A few weeks later, the needle stopped moving above 150 degrees no matter what temperature the oven was actually at. What started as a good purchase has since become a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t seem accurate
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t read accurately in my new oven. I had a repair man come & his professional thermometer read 40 degrees different than this one. Maybe mine is defective? I’m ordering a different brand to see..
customer_reviews.author: barnyardcarol

customer_reviews.title: Finally figured out why things were so hard to bake!
customer_reviews.text: After restarting my baking hobby, I had issues making everything turn out the way I wanted. Either burnt or still undercooked on the inside. Turns out my old oven is off a few degrees (anywhere from 5-20 F depending on the day!) Even if your oven isn't as temperamental as mine, this is valuable for ensuring you have a constant and accurate baking/cooking/smoking temperature. Saved my butt plenty when baking breads.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor I.

customer_reviews.title: Very poor design
customer_reviews.text: This thing falls over constantly. If I hang it on the rack then pull the rack out it falls off. Ditto if it is sitting on the rack. It is so unstable it falls over if you breathe on it. I have fished it off the floor of my oven so many times, which is quite a trick to get it without burning myself. I hate the thing with the heat of a thousand ovens!
customer_reviews.author: Jax

customer_reviews.title: Dial displaced. Browning after using it for just under 3 months
customer_reviews.text: It was initially very good but the dial got offset after using it for less than 3 months. The exterior turned brown which makes it look very worn out. I believe the temp is not accurate after awhile as I had to preheat my oven at 30F higher than the thermostat. Recently my bakes gets way too dark too soon, meaning that it is no longer giving an accurate reading. Such a pity that it is only useful for 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Toh

customer_reviews.title: works great and easy to read
customer_reviews.text: The oven does not always tell the truth and I wanted a second opinion. This is easy to read and I am able to put it on a rack so I can see it through the window. It does exactly what it needs to do.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Mom's Oven Off 50°
customer_reviews.text: I finally convinced my mom to tell her landlord she had a broken oven after proving to her that her oven was a slow cooker. He said the unit was new, but the last thing he said that about was 30 years old. I am just glad she is cooking her food to temp until then thanks to this handy gadget.
customer_reviews.author: CE

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I’m partial to Taylor thermometer products and suspected my oven was off by about 10°. I put this into my oven which was preheated to 350°. The thermometer never reached above 210° even though my cake baked in 25 minutes as usual. I’m sorry I ever bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: I wish it’s more accurate
customer_reviews.text: Since it’s taking too long to warm up the oven. I decided to test this product with my other three thermometer at the same time (one also from Taylor that I got from Target but small size). It turns out that this product doesn’t reach 350°F like the other three! It only reaches 305°F. So, be aware of this. 2 stars for the large size which make it easier to read.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Needed to check the accuracy of the oven temperature and this was great to use. Put it in the middle of the oven to check instead of by the door and could see the temp just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy or there about
customer_reviews.text: I suspected that my oven was going out and wanted an independent method to verify the temperature. I purchased this gauge, and BAM, I was right. A 375 degree oven should not feel like a warm yoga studio. Great way to verify oven temperature. Big, easy to read dial. Requires no power or batteries. The needle moves up- the right- when the temperature goes up and to the left when the temperature goes down. It didn't melt, of course, I didn't leave it in the over on a self-clean cycle, but the oven is broken and ain't no point in cleaning it. Highly recommend- the gauge, not my oven.
customer_reviews.author: michael serrano

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: This thermometer did not perform well. It has become dark on the glass part from just regular use. I bought it because it seemed like my oven was not heating properly and I needed to record the temperature. The thermometer did not live up to my expectations since it discolored so badly which makes it hard to read the temperature. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Marion Bruckner

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: This worked well for several weeks, then stopped showing accurate temp. Oven set for 350 to 400 showing that temp with other thermometer - this thermometer does not show more than 250 degrees. Never dropped never in water - just stopped showing accurate temp. Too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Bronsberg

customer_reviews.title: Not Stable, Can't read while in Oven
customer_reviews.text: As a thermometer, it read correctly, however getting the thermometer to stand up in the oven is very difficult so I can't read it when I turn the oven light on, I have to open and check everything. I was hoping for something more convenient, but it does read the temperature accurately so that's good.
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn Stout

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Read Large Dial - like it a lot
customer_reviews.text: When the thermometer arrived, I checked the gauge and it was precisely right on. Just what I expected by buying a known brand such as Taylor. The dial is a pleasure to use. The larger 3" size makes it much more readable that standard size. I am delighted I bought this oven thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Grammie Annie

customer_reviews.title: Great thermometer
customer_reviews.text: I always thought my oven temp was a little wonky so I decided to check it by purchasing a thermometer. Since I have other Taylor products I decided to buy this one. The thermometer is quite big which is good. The numbers are easy to read and it can be hung from the oven shelf or put on top of it. Well made and solid but not heavy. And it turned out that yes my oven temp was wonky. 25 degrees less than the setting. Good to know and now I just set it higher
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this oven thermometer because it had a large easily read extra large dial, and the price was good. The dial has a range that goes up to 600 degree F as well. I found that the thermometer read about 40 degree high, which maybe I could work around, but after preheating my oven to 500 deg for bread baking, the dial became grey and faded and impossible to read while in the oven. Unusable.
customer_reviews.author: C. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Taylor oven thermometer a month ago. My oven was not heating correctly hence this purchase but this thermometer was so off that there was no way of knowing which was right. I ended up buying a new range and at 400* the thermometer was registering 360*!
customer_reviews.author: Frederica

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work!
customer_reviews.text: This does not work!!! The temperature reads 350 no matter what the oven is set at. Even when it’s cold! Amazon will not allow me to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Tynicoledesigns

customer_reviews.title: Check your oven
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned that my oven temperature was not accurate. I found thermometer this to be consistent and useful. I wish it were easier to hang on the rack. I learned that when my oven says it is 450F, it will get there, but it takes more time than I thought. I seemed good at lower temperature as well. It is easy to read. So it turned out that this thermometer agrees with my oven thermometer over a range of temperatures, making me think both are accurate. (You would need a better standard to be sure--but it appears to do good work.)
customer_reviews.author: babs

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, hard to read and inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: The front of the thermometer immediately turned brownish from white. Is it heatproof? Doesn't look to be. And it read my temperature at 100 degrees lower. If that were the case, I'd never had been able to bake cookies at recommended temps and times, which I often do. Inexpensive--cheap would be a better description.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t not work - don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: This item is a piece of junk. It tells me my oven is 100 degrees cooler than what the oven is supposed to be at, when I know for a fact that’s not true since my baked goods burn if I set the oven at the temperature recommended by the recipe. If you are looking for a serious thermometer, invest a little bit more and get yourself a thermostat that does work.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvain

customer_reviews.title: Only had since February 24 and it is not showing the correct temperature
customer_reviews.text: Only had since February 24th and it is not showing the correct temperature. I am unable to return since it is out of the warranty period. I had to get a different brand and it shows my oven temperature correctly. This one is obviously faulty and flawed. I wish I could get a new one since it seems to be made really well but it does not give the accurate temperature. I am not happy at all with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Karen U.

customer_reviews.title: Taylor Classic Thermometer
customer_reviews.text: I was just not sure about my oven. I also live at an high altitude. Well this Taylor Thermometer gave me peace of mind. Everything is just working fine 😁
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: It never worked.
customer_reviews.text: I tried this thermometer out a few days after I got it. I put it in the oven and then looked at it after the oven was at 350 degrees F. The indicating arm never moved. As I rotated the thermometer upside down and the arm just kept pointing down. It doesn't appear to be attached to anything. Oh well. Win some - lose some. Chalk this up in the loss column. I hadn't noticed that it was non-returnable. My fault. I won't make that mistake again.
customer_reviews.author: Gene W. Brown

customer_reviews.title: More Accurate and Easier to see
customer_reviews.text: Face it, getting older isn't easy and having an oven thermometer with easier to read numbers helps. I left my old smaller one in with this new one and the new one is definitely more accurate. Highly recommend for those of us who can use a little extra help.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, but doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: This works great for hanging or sitting in the oven. However, it has gotten charred and hasn't lasted very long with regular everyday usage. It still works and shows an accurate temperature, it is just charred and hard to read sometimes!
customer_reviews.author: Allyse

customer_reviews.title: Burned Up
customer_reviews.text: The best part about this thermometer is the size and the ability to read it at a glance. The worst part about this thermometer- it does not like high temps. Mine burned up after about an hour in the 575-degree range. :(
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Keene

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Very inaccurate....if anything, I thought my oven was a little too hot. At 350, it kept reading 250. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T WORK
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this thermometer, it seemed to function, but has never reset back down and is stuck at temperature 325 degrees, even out of the oven at room temperature, so it is worthless to me. I have already discarded the packaging and don't want the hassle of trying to return and item this inexpensive, but it is just irritating that it didn't work and I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Casey S.

customer_reviews.title: So-so device
customer_reviews.text: Bought based on positive recommendation. Accuracy is not good at least 25 degrees off actual temp.
customer_reviews.author: Don Birkelbach

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This scale has been very helpful in knowing the true temperature of our oven (which we found out was inaccurate!). It is small so doesn't get in the way of your baking trays. It has the capability to either hang from a rack, or you can place it on a rack/bottom of the oven as there is also a stand. Can't beat the price either. This has definitely helped improve my baking!
customer_reviews.author: LaurD

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after one single use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to confirm the temperature of the broiling mode in both my range and toaster oven. Well, I still don't know because after using this gauge I had totally different readings - like 100 deg F difference. Then the needle would not come down anymore - stuck at 200 F at room temperature. Useless ans not returnable. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Gerhard G.

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than the picture for easy reading
customer_reviews.text: Moved into apartments where a new stove was in the kitchen and ruined a couple of baking items. So I bought this so could tell what temperature my oven really was and it's been a super fix, and haven't had undercooked or overcooked recipes at all.
customer_reviews.author: Sneakydelicious

customer_reviews.title: Turn Up The Heat
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. Simple, easy to use. Is accurate (I guess) I purchased this to help me recalibrate my new oven. Only to discover that my oven is already heating at the prescribed temperatures. I will say that this device helped me expose my oven as a liar. My oven beeps, once pre-heated, to my desired temp. setting. However, according to this temperature gauge, it's still about 60o - 70o to go. Shame on you Whirlpool. You were doing so well.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Moore

customer_reviews.title: Works great and accurate
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put in a brand new oven to make sure it kept the correct temperature. It has worked great. (Hint..Don't be stupid and keep it in the oven when you use the automatic cleaner part of your oven. It fried it up good. That’s what happened to my last one. I mean someone else’s.)
customer_reviews.author: Mr Houston

customer_reviews.title: VERY EASY TO READ
customer_reviews.text: I am able to read this thermometer without picking it up. I now know that I need to have my oven recalibrated. Very easy to read
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Just the thing i needed!
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to this thermometer, i know that my oven's temperature is accurate, but takes much longer than the indicator light on the stove to actually get to temperature. So i now know to preheat sooner, and make sure the temp is right. Wonderful consistent baked goods since i got this.
customer_reviews.author: Seain Gutridge

customer_reviews.title: Still not right temp
customer_reviews.text: I needed one for my oven because I started to bake a lot of gluten free things and the temperature setting has to be perfect so it doesn’t get gummy. I have adjusted my oven temp according to this thermometer but for some reason my baking is still gummy which is an indication of hotter oven so I think I need to adjust it a little lower
customer_reviews.author: Thuy

customer_reviews.title: Like the big dial and larger numbers.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this thermometer because of the larger dial and numbers printed on it. Was able to hang it on the rack in the oven and read it through the window in the oven door, something I haven't been able to do with smaller oven thermometers.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Nice oven theremoter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I feel like Taylor is the place to go for anything to do with thermometers or scales. This sits nice on the shelf cause the base is bigger than most and the dial is very easy to read. Now if only they could come up with a way to keep the glass clean when you leave it in and the glass gets spotted.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Lou Sansone

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the oven thermometer because I think my oven is too cool. I placed the thermometer in the oven and it doesn’t work. The only way the spinner moves is when I manually tilt the thermometer. I now find I can’t send it back and Amazon says this item is not eligible for return or customer support. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: SandyA

customer_reviews.title: Get Your Oven to the Right Temperature
customer_reviews.text: I kept baking tried-and-true recipes in a different oven and things weren't working out. I purchased this to verify the oven temperature and found it approx 25 degrees off. I rely on this thermometer exclusively now and have no problems whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: BKnight

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: Initially, I gave this item a 5-star review as I was ecstatic to not receive a faulty product that other consumers were getting. However, that 5-star rating is no longer fitting. I turned my oven to 350 in preparation to bake some goods. The thermometer showed 410. I adjusted the oven to a lower temperature. The thermometer never changed. I pulled it out, put it on the counter, and thirty minutes later as I adjust this review, it still reads 410 degrees. I have had this for not even a month.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn Whichard

customer_reviews.title: BIGGER than normal
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted everyone to know that this thermometer is larger than usual, which makes the letters easier to read but it does hang down lower then a normal size oven thermometer. It's just as accurate as the normal sized one.
customer_reviews.author: tabbycat

customer_reviews.title: Already Broken
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this "made in China" oven thermometer as I was having a lot of issues with my oven temperature according to a no-name thermometer that was in there. I purchased this so that I could verify the no-name thermometer was not at fault. I found that both thermometers were reading the same temperatures and thus knew my oven was indeed at fault. Fast forward 6-months and this thermometer stopped working which was very surprising given Taylor's brand name. I emailed customer service and heard nothing back. The no-name thermometer continues to function and it is several years old. Very disappointed in Taylor and will not buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Burt Feggs

customer_reviews.title: Broken glass
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this and haven't had it that long and the glass broke on it. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Overman

customer_reviews.title: Worked decently for a week. Now broken.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to check and see if my oven maintained temperature. It worked well for that purpose but I cannot speak to the actual accuracy of the device. The thermometer broke after two runs through the oven. The hand is stuck at around 175 degrees at room temperature. I never heated the oven past 400 degrees while it was in there. It's a decent cheap way to diagnose issues with your oven, but do not rely on it for anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Merc

customer_reviews.title: Is there a zero star option?
customer_reviews.text: This thermometer is so inaccurate, the gas company came out on a wild goose chase. I bought it to see if my oven needed recalibrating, and based on how inaccurate it is (20-40 degrees), I thought boy did. The gas company came out and couldn’t figure out why the oven function seemed to be fine, but the temps were so off. It wasn’t until he pulled out his thermometer that I felt so bad for calling them to come out. He was quite kind because he felt so bad that I trusted this absolute scam of a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: gg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, as long as you don't cook over 300
customer_reviews.text: I used this alongside another thermometer in two different ovens, one of which has a built in thermometer. At 375 degrees, this thermometer would not get above 300 degrees, even after being left in the ovens for over 30 minutes each time. Was not allowed to return the item for some reason, even though it was defective, so this was just a loss.
customer_reviews.author: wendee

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: I have one of those apartment-sized gas stoves that are a little smaller than standard sized stoves. While you can set the temperature of the stove, there's not indicator to say that it is at the temp you set. This thermometer does the trick! It also helped me realize that my stove can go as low as 140 degrees so I can even do some dehydrating in it.
customer_reviews.author: BSUNG

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: I was testing this thermometer for accuracy by heating my oven to 350, and this POS thermometer exploded.
customer_reviews.author: dealzappealz

customer_reviews.title: You can always count on Taylor Products
customer_reviews.text: The Taylor Precision temperature gauge is large enough to see easily when I place it in my electric wall ov en. It is great because it proved our thoughts on why in the upper oven was 20 degrees hotter than what we set it at, and 40 degrees lower in the lower oven from our setting. Thanks Taylor for making such an accurate and trustworthy product. You can always count on a Taylor temperature gauge to provide the most accurate temperature readings. I am thinking about buying another for the other wall oven, so I don't have to switch the one I have each time. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Helsel

customer_reviews.title: You'll be surprised how much better everything comes out
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely pick this up if you have trouble baking. I would bet your oven is not achieving the temperature you set it to. This takes the guesswork out of baking. Once you've used it for a while you do that have to look at it all that frequently, as you'll know if you want 350, on your oven, you need to set it to 375 or 340. You'll be surprised how much better everything comes out. Update:. Steam from baking fogged the cover and it won't bake off. Downgraded to to three stars.
customer_reviews.author: ADK

customer_reviews.title: I really like this product
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a large, easy to read oven thermometer. Very frustrating. Why do so many other makers provide a large dial and then use little numbers? While the numbers could still be bigger on this product, they are easy to read. I have used it several times and it is accurate (which is also a nice change for me as other product have not been). So I can recommend this product to others who are looking for an accurate, easy to read oven thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Bea

customer_reviews.title: Nice thermometer.
customer_reviews.text: Nice thermometer. We have an older oven that we suspected of providing spurious performance. We purchased this thermometer as a way to check on our oven and found that indeed our oven was not up to par in the higher temperature ranges. Now we use this thermometer ever time we use the oven. The base is large enough that the thermometer sits in the oven without fear of tipping over. Easy to read!
customer_reviews.author: P. Prince

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: Wish i would’ve seen that this isn’t returnable. Wasted money as it is not accurate at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, sometimes spins so I can’t see it
customer_reviews.text: My oven runs very low so this has been great for my baking. The only downside is that I have it hanging from a rack and sometimes it will spin so i can’t see it. It would be nice to be able to fix it in one direction.
customer_reviews.author: Brady Burr

customer_reviews.title: Was not at all accurate.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to attempt to calibrate my new oven. This thermometer was all over the place, and sometimes wasn't within 100 degrees. I had to eventually guess and check until recipes started cooking in the right amount of time because the thermometer was useless. Would not recommend if you want any sort of accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Brian T

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My oven cooks way to high so I need a thermometer to see what temperature it actually was. When I set my oven to 200 the thermometer says it’s at 500.
customer_reviews.author: Elisha

customer_reviews.title: This product was inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: We have two ovens. One works perfectly fine, but we thought the other one wasn't gtting up to temperature. We bought this thermometer to see if we were correct. We put it in the oven and heated the oven to 400 degrees. It read less than 300. We tried it in the other oven (that works) and it said the same thing. The thermometer didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: M Pryslak

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this oven thermometer. Couldn’t see the tiny numbers on my old one anymore and this one is much easier to see. Also found out my oven needed to be recalibrated because the temperature was off. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: T. Bentivegna

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and easy to read.
customer_reviews.text: This thermometer is awesome. Really didn’t know how much the temp could vary in different spots on my smoker and bbq pit. I’ve bought several of these now. Easy to clean as they do get dirty when cooking on the grill. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: michael odonnell

customer_reviews.title: It's ok but good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great value. We bought this as we accidentally broke the knob on our oven and the parts are discontinued and we cant afford to replace it just yet. Takes a bit to measure temperatures when you are trying to regulate but read well and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Clara

customer_reviews.title: Works but turns brown
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy use in the oven if not a bit unstable sitting on the rack. Fairly easy to read, but I needed a flashligh to see well through the oven door. Seems accurate enough for the purpose. Sadly after only one use the face turned light brown - will probably darken with continued use.
customer_reviews.author: RuCYnic

product_meta.title: Taylor Classic Series Large Dial Oven Thermometer
product_meta.description: Ensure your food is cooking at the proper temperature with this large dial oven thermometer from Taylor. An extra-large, colorful 3. 25" Dial makes this wireless oven thermometer easy to read. The oven temperature gauge also features a glass lens with a Red Pointer to indicate accurate temperatures from 100 to 600 degrees Fahrenheit. Stainless steel construction provides strength, durability, and corrosion resistance. Uniquely designed for all oven types, This large dial thermometer can be hung from a rack or stand on it's own.
feature_bullets: Extra large dial: The extra-large and colorful 3” analog dial makes it easy to read the measurements.
Oven safe durability: glass lens and stainless steel construction is resistant to corrosion and provides strong, dependable quality.
Versatile design: thermometer can be hung from a rack or stand on its own in the oven.

Highly accurate: ensure that food is always cooking at the proper temperature with readings from 100°f – 600°F. Convenient warming, baking, and roasting zones are printed on the dial for easy reference.
One Year limited : this thermometer is backed with a 1-year so you can make your purchase with Confidence.
Use and care: for best results, hand wash the thermometer; do not put thermometer in the dishwasher.
Nsf: the thermometer is NSF (National Sanitation foundation) certified so it complies with all required standards for the quality, durability and cleanability of consumer products.
Important: thermometer will be hot after use.   use potholders or oven mitts when handling hot thermometer.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars5,371 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
